content.text:
# 2013 Outer Critics Circle Awards

| venue = Sardi's
| hosts = Judy Kaye, Audra McDonald, Michael McGrath, Donna Murphy and Tonya Pinkins
}}
The 2013 Outer Critics Circle Awards winners were announced on May 13, 2014, recognizing excellence in Broadway and Off-Broadway productions during the 2012â€“13 season. Nominations were announced on April 22, 2013, with the revival of Pippin leading the nominations with 11. Following close behind were Kinky Boots with nine, and Chaplin and ''Rodgers and Hammerstein's Cinderella, both with eight nominations. Among plays, The Nance and Golden Boy led with six nominations, the most of any play.
The biggest winner of the year was the revival of Pippin which won seven of its 11 nominations. Kinky Boots followed, winning three awards. With two wins each were Matilda, My Name is Asher Lev, The Nance and Vanya and Sonia and Masha and Spike''.
Awards and nominations
The award winners were announced on May 13, 2013, followed by an awards ceremony at Sardi's featuring Judy Kaye, Audra McDonald, Michael McGrath, Donna Murphy and Tonya Pinkins as presenters.
